reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Business Corporations Act and Cooperative Association Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Cooperative Association Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Cooperative Association Act;
appellant means a person who intends to appeal under section 37 (3) of the Act, or who has commenced such an appeal;
filing fees means the cost of filing the notice of appeal required by section 37 (4) of the Act or an application for an order under section 172.1 of the Act;
monthly housing charge means the amount a member must pay to the housing cooperative each month for the use, occupation or enjoyment of residential premises in the housing cooperative.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 1 (1) of the Act, the following persons are exempt from the definition of "director":

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lawyer, accountant or other professional if the person's primary participation in the management of the association is the provision of professional services to the association;

a trustee in bankruptcy who participates in the management of the association or exercises control over its property, rights and interests primarily for the purpose of administering the estate of the association;

a receiver, receiver manager or secured creditor of the association who participates in the management of the association or exercises control over its property, rights and interests primarily for the purpose of enforcing a debt obligation of the association.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Criteria to be considered by registrar
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 2 (2) of the Act, the following are the prescribed criteria the registrar must take into account:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the number of members of the association;
the nature and extent of the association's assets and liabilities;
the manner by which the association is carrying out its purpose;
funding received by the association, directly or indirectly, from the government of British Columbia or of Canada;
the memorandum and rules of the association;
any circumstances the registrar considers relevant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Conditions for housing cooperative — termination of membership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 156/2018, App., s. 1 (a).]

If the directors of a housing cooperative serve notice of the termination of a membership under section 36 (2) (e) of the Act or if the members of a housing cooperative confirm the termination of a membership under section 37 (2) (b) of the Act, the housing cooperative must comply with the following conditions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 12/2014, s. 1 (b).]

at the written request of the appellant, if the appellant is not in arrears for any monthly housing charge, issue to the appellant the amount of the filing fees made payable to the court registry in which the notice of appeal is to be filed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If there is a dispute between the appellant and the housing cooperative respecting the amount of the monthly housing charge, the amount of the monthly housing charge referred to in subsection (1) (b) is the amount of that charge that is not in dispute.
The request under subsection (1) (b) must be made within 10 days after the day the appellant is served with the notice under section 36 (2) (e) or 37 (2.1) (a) (i) of the Act.
If the appellant fails to make the request under subsection (1) (b) within the period set out in subsection (3), the housing cooperative may, but need not, issue the amount of the filing fees.

If the housing cooperative has issued an amount under subsection (1) (b) and the court upholds the decision of the directors or the members, as the case may be, to terminate the appellant's membership, the amount paid under subsection (1) (b) is a debt due to the housing cooperative from the appellant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of right to appeal termination of membership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 36 (3) of the Act, Form 9.1 of Schedule C is prescribed.
For the purpose of section 37 (2.1) (a) (ii) of the Act, Form 9 of Schedule C is prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 12/2014, s. 1 (d).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fees association may charge for copies

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 132 of the Act, the amount prescribed that an association may charge for a copy of a record is 25 cents per page.
For the purpose of section 142 (2) of the Act, the amount prescribed that an association may charge for each additional copy of the association's memorandum and rules is 25 cents per page.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amount of unpaid liability requiring creditor's consent
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 197 (1) (c) (ii) of the Act, the amount prescribed of an unpaid claim for which written consent to a provision for payment is required is $200.
For the purpose of section 201 (3) of the Act, the amount prescribed for each day that an offence under section 199 (d) of the Act continues is $50.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Date of compliance for pre-existing associations
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 214 (2) of the Act, the date by which a pre-existing association must change its memorandum and rules is January 31, 2003.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Matters that must be provided for in rules of association
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 13 (2) of the Act, the following matters are prescribed as those that must be provided for in the rules of an association, in addition to the matters that, under the Act, must be provided for in those rules:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to membership in the association,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: setting the terms of admission,
specifying the rights and, if any, the obligations and limitations of membership, and
designating classes of membership, if more than one, and the rights and, if any, the obligations and limitations attached to each class;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to shares of the association,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifying, if applicable, the maximum number of membership shares that a person or eligible organization may hold,
specifying whether, and if so how, investment shares may be transferred and a form of transfer,
providing for the transmission of shares on the death or bankruptcy of an individual member, and
setting out the effect on the ownership of shares of the bankruptcy, liquidation or dissolution of a shareholder that is not an individual;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to directors and officers of the association,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifying the number of directors,
setting out restrictions, if any, on the powers of directors,
providing for the conduct of meetings of the directors,
setting the terms of office of directors and officers,
providing for the appointment and removal of officers, and
setting out the powers and duties of officers;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to the financial management of the association,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: setting out the borrowing powers of the association,
setting out the investment powers of the association,
providing for the distribution of surplus funds, and
providing for the redemption of shares at the option of the association, if applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to general meetings of the association,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: convening and holding general meetings, and
setting out voting rights and procedures for persons attending in a representative capacity;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with respect to meetings of investment shareholders or of investment shareholders of a particular class of investment shares,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: convening and holding meetings of investment shareholders or of investment shareholders of a particular class of investment shares, and
setting out voting rights and procedures for persons attending in a representative capacity;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the giving of notice to the association;
the service of documents by the association;
the execution of documents and the use and custody of the seal of the association, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 210 of the Act, a person must pay to the registrar the amount set out in Column 2 of Schedule A for the service or matter set out opposite in Column 1 of that Schedule.
For the purpose of section 13 (1) of the Act, Schedule B is prescribed as the form of rules that an association may adopt.
The forms in Schedule C are prescribed for the purposes of the Act and this regulation.

For the purposes of the provisions of the Act that authorize the registrar to publish a notice in a prescribed manner, the registrar may publish the notice by including it on a website maintained by or on behalf of the government.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manner of filing records with registrar
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless otherwise required or permitted by the registrar for the purposes of the Act, a record filed with or provided or submitted to the registrar must be filed, provided or submitted in an electronic format that is compatible with the technical requirements of the registrar.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manner in which registrar may provide records
bcl:section.bcl:text: A record that the registrar is required to provide or certify under the Act may be provided or certified by electronic means.

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
For incorporation or amalgamation, including filing of memorandum and
rules, or restoration of association
For a certified true copy or extract

For a search conducted using BC OnLine information service using a
person's own computer terminal

For a search conducted using BC OnLine information service by a
person using a computer terminal provided by the government

For a search conducted by government personnel except a search made
as part of the registrar's review of an application to hold or reserve a name
For registration, amalgamation or restoration of an extraprovincial association
For filing or registering any notice, return or other document required by the Act
For a copy of, or extract from, a document for every page or part of a page
For pre-vetting of documents to be filed with the registrar
For filing an annual report
For filing and certification of resolutions as required by the Act
For changing the name of an association or extraprovincial association
For a continuation under section 183 or 187 of the Act
For the search of a maximum of 3 names, on application for approval or reservation of a name
For a priority service, when offered

bcl:footnote.bcl:text: A further operator charge of $1.50 plus tax imposed under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act (Canada) is applicable to any BC Online search conducted by anyone other than government personnel.

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: The rules adopted by an association may be in this form, a modified form of these Rules or in another form altogether. These Rules will accommodate an association that is not a housing cooperative and that has share capital consisting of membership shares with par value and investment shares that may be issued only to members. Please review these Rules carefully to determine whether they will meet the needs and objectives of your association. Whatever the form of rules adopted, they must address each matter required by section 10 of the regulation and must be read in conjunction with and subject to the Cooperative Association Act.

oasis:line.in:a: Notice of death or bankruptcy of individual member
Notice of bankruptcy, liquidation or dissolution of eligible organization member
Effect of termination, withdrawal or other cessation of membership
Entitlement of joint members to act as directors
Calls on unpaid amount of membership shares
Dividends or interest on membership shares
Effective date of transfer of shares
Effect of lien on transfer or assignment of shares
Procedure on death of a member
Registration of share prohibited if person entitled is not a member
Association authorized to purchase and redeem its shares
Purchase of shares to be made ratably
Sale and voting of redeemed shares
Redemption of shares on withdrawal of membership
Redemption of shares on termination of membership

in:strong.in:a: Part 10 — Register of Members and Register of Investment Shareholders

oasis:line.in:a: Register of Members and Register of Investment Shareholders

in:strong.in:a: Part 11 — General Meetings of the Association

oasis:line.in:a: Order of business at annual general meeting
Time and place of general meetings
Provision for 2 or more general meetings for the same matters
Notice of general meetings of the Association
Meeting valid despite failure to give notice
Actions to be determined by ordinary resolution
Chair not entitled to casting vote
Decisions by show of hands or poll
Chair must resolve dispute on a poll
Demand for a poll on adjournment
Demand for a poll not to prevent continuance of meeting
Rules relating to general meetings apply
Notice of meeting of investment shareholders

oasis:line.in:a: Votes of persons in representative capacity
Executors or administrators as joint shareholders
Proxy voting at a general meeting
